itemDescription: Lancaster Jesuit priest; one of the Forty Martyrs of England and Wales

wikipedia_page.main: Edmund Arrowsmith, SJ,  (1585 – 28 August 1628) is one of the Forty Martyrs of England and Wales of the  Catholic Church. The main source of information on Arrowsmith is a contemporary account written by an eyewitness and published a short time after his death. This document, conforming to the ancient style of the "Acts of martyrs" includes the story of the execution of another 17th-century Recusant martyr, Richard Herst.
